intro: Serjania sufferruginea, commonly known as the rusty serjania, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a rough texture. Serjania sufferruginea is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in humid, shaded environments.
